body: Try `stats.children: true` to get more info

That. Was. Fast. _... and it did the trick._

I think "stats" is a poorly chosen name for this. I would expect _statistics_ not errors when being enabled.
We should add a hint to the message pointing to this option
Yes, that's a really good suggestion and a time saver!

issue.title: hint about how to show child errors and warnings

repository.name: webpack
repository.description: A bundler for javascript and friends. Packs many modules into a few bundled assets. Code Splitting allows for loading parts of the application on demand. Through "loaders", modules can be CommonJs, AMD, ES6 modules, CSS, Images, JSON, Coffeescript, LESS, ... and your custom stuff.

body: Can somebody tell me where I need to put the ;stats.children: true' bit in my react project please?

> # "Bug" report
> When compiling the message `1 ERROR in child compilations` appears. However, no additional information is printed. When debugging into this I noticed that `compilation.errorsCount` is set to `1`, however `compilation.errors` is an empty array.
> 
> Relevant function:
> 
> https://github.com/webpack/webpack/blob/7f3f7805b9325f3da05540a37a027823719007ab/lib/stats/DefaultStatsPrinterPlugin.js#L200
> 
> My wild uneducated guess is that the "child" throws an error without a message.
> 
> **What is the current behavior?**
> 
> This is the output I'm facing. However, `1 ERROR in child compilations` is not helpful without saying _which_ child is causing trouble.
> 
> ```
> $ webpack --mode=production
> assets by status 20.6 MiB [cached] 144 assets
> orphan modules 46.2 KiB [orphan] 34 modules
> runtime modules 3.76 KiB 8 modules
> modules by path ../node_modules/core-js/ 381 KiB 382 modules
> modules by path ../node_modules/moment/ 672 KiB 137 modules
> modules by path ./ 101 KiB (javascript) 358 KiB (css/mini-extract) 20 modules
> modules by path ../node_modules/bootstrap-table/dist/ 204 KiB (javascript) 9.4 KiB (css/mini-extract) 6 modules
> modules by path ../node_modules/i18n/ 44 KiB 3 modules
> modules by path ../node_modules/bootstrap-datepicker/dist/ 57 KiB (javascript) 22.2 KiB (css/mini-extract) 3 modules
> modules by path ../node_modules/url/ 37.4 KiB 3 modules
> modules by path ../node_modules/querystring/*.js 4.51 KiB 3 modules
> modules by path ../node_modules/quill/dist/ 429 KiB (javascript) 24.7 KiB (css/mini-extract) 2 modules
> modules by path ../node_modules/debug/src/*.js 11.8 KiB 2 modules
> modules by path ../node_modules/@stripe/stripe-js/ 4.35 KiB 2 modules
> 23 modules
> 1 ERROR in child compilations
> webpack 5.21.2 compiled with 1 error in 101752 ms
> ```
> 
> **If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce.**
> 
> _It's not really a bug, rather missing information_
> 
> **What is the expected behavior?**
> 
> I expect to _at least_ know what is causing trouble, even if it's something like this:
> 
> ```
> 1 ERROR in child compilations:
> - MyBrokenPlugin returned exit code 1337 without an error message.
> ```
> 
> **Other relevant information:** webpack version: 5.21.2 Node.js version: 14.5.5 (LTS) Operating System: macOS Big Sur 11.2 Additional tools: N/A

I have the same problem.... on Macbook 14''  M1 Pro, node:16.13.0

The color-adjust shorthand is currently deprecated and it depends on the autoprefixer@10.4.6. 
[autoprefixer: Replace color-adjust to print-color-adjust. #36259](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/issues/36259)

I was able to fix this by reverting the autoprefixer package to version 10.4.5, run this:

`npm install autoprefixer@10.4.5 --save-exact`
@crisnunez1 Annoying thing, thanks for shorthand solution ðŸ‘
in my case.. it throwing this error because i didn't have a file that i prefaced in webpack.config.js first.. after i created the file.. all is good.. maybe this tip will help someone :)
